They really need to redesign how parachutes work, in the game they produce a fix amount of drag per velocity, but not air pressure, so say when landing on Duna and going several hundred m/s when they open can lead to catastrophic deceleration.

i think they should open within a certain amount of air pressure, universal on all planets, rather than simply at 500 m hard n flat

The only problem I have with parachutes is phy-warping while waiting for the main 'chutes to deploy. 99% of the time, it will simply blow up the craft. Just make sure you don't use any type of time warp while deploying parachutes.

i think they should open within a certain amount of air pressure, universal on all planets, rather than simply at 500 m hard n flat

Parachutes fully deploy at a fixed altitude by design; use drogues or retrorockets to slow down more beforehand, or make your spacecraft stronger.

Parachutes do semi-deploy based on pressure, so you won't be spun right round when they fully deploy.

Parachutes fully deploy at a fixed altitude by design; use drogues or retrorockets to slow down more beforehand, or make your spacecraft stronger.

From what reading I've done, that's also how they can be made to work in real life as well. They're kept reefed by means of a mechanism that keeps the skirt drawn tightly together, much like a drawstring on a bag. At a predetermined command, this mechanism can be released, effectively "cutting the string" and allowing the air to fully open the chute.

Curiosity hit 9-gees when deploying the parachute on Mars, and even that wasn't enough to completely slow the spacecraft down from traveling at interplanetary speeds. It was still falling at something like 1,000 mph after the main parachute had deployed and was cut loose. I like the way that ksp handles parachutes in the game, the only thing that I don't like about them is the inability to 'stack' anything on top of them - for example another parachute that is meant to be cut away prior to the opening of the main parachutes, or for that matter a docking port.

It would be nice to have a number of pre-set parachute controls that can be changed depending on the type of parachute and planet however. For example the ability to manually edit the parachute's default opening altitude while in flight.

I do wish that KSP allowed you to set a value for when the parachutes deploy complete. Either in the VAB, allow you to set an action key or else just have a single stack deployment have them extend and a second open the chute.

Beyond that, please allow radial drouge chutes SQUAD!!!

In addition to stock radial drogues I'd like to see a small-scale stack drogue to match the Mk16 parachute. A stack parachute that deploys chutes from the sides allowing you to put docking ports/etc. on top of it would be nice, but might make things a little too easy.

The parachutes definitely need some love though, I don't think they've changed since 0.8, except for the cut/repack option. Even the model for the Mk16 is still the same.

Beyond that, please allow radial drouge chutes SQUAD!!!

Agree with this generally (MOAR OPTIONS = BETTER), but you could achieve the same thing by using the top drogue and then using the radial mains.
